item.description:

item.title: Overflowing bins, 29th December
item.description:
Overflowing bins. The ones attached to lampposts. Listed as fixed but they don’t to have been emptied. the bins are still full and overflowing as previously reported. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resident’s parking bays, 29th December
item.description:
In Blackthorn Grove DA74EH the markings in ALL the resident’s parking bays have vanished over the years. This results in incorrect parking by vehicles not allowing 2 vehicles to park . New lines defining the bays are required

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackthorn Grove, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kids on motorbikes, 29th December
item.description:
Kids riding two motorbikes very fast around the park while there are small kids and off lead dogs. They live on Dorchester Avenue and their garage opens on the park at the Murchison Avenue entrance. I'm sure this is illegal and also very dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bladindon Drive, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Fly posting alleyway

item.title: Please clean the street, 29th December

Litter here is awful please clear

item.title: The street is in such state, 29th December
item.description:
Please clear all the litter and rubbish from around the bus stop and the whole length of the road here

item.title: Fridge & other rubbish dumped, 29th December
item.description:
Also saw a couple throwing some wooden items here. On being challenged, they claimed they have arranged a pickup, and that the fridge is not theirs. This is a regular dumping site--please use cameras and proper enforcement.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): King Edwards Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lamp (without column number) is unilluminated on the north side of fox Hill Road outside of the house here. If you were to be standing on the fox Hill green, looking in a northwesterly, this would be the column on your right hand side. Please see to the photos submitted with this report, 29th December
item.description:
Street Lighting - Maintenance Lat/Long - 51.4147042, -0.0763075 what3words - brings.lonely.farm Nearest address - 66A, Belvedere Road, Anerley, London, SE19 2HW
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fox Hill, Upper Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Horses abandoned in Footscray meadows, 29th December
item.description:
These horses are being kept right off the footpath at foots cray meadows. I’ve never seen this before so don’t believe it’s supposed to be used for this purpose and it didn’t look appropriate (litter everywhere, nowhere suitable to graze). Seems as if the land is being misappropriated and concerns for animal welfare. The location on what3words was snow.chats.laws

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Spinney, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van dumped has no MOT and a SORN status parked on public road, 29th December
item.description:
No MOT and has no tax. Partly blocking dropped curb. Parked on corner of Clarence Road & Birkbeck Road. This seems to be a popular place to park untaxed and no MOT cars/vans by probably the same person.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Crescent, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped some weeks ago, 29th December
item.description:
Please clear

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Larkhall Rise, Clapham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken pieces of pavement wall, 29th December
item.description:
Three sections of the wall leading from the flats on the corner of Eltham Road and Ravens Way to the corner of Ravens Way and Ravens Mews are broken all the way down from the top to the bottom. The broken bits are nearer to the Ravens Mews end.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ravens Mews, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The use of the rear garden as a builders yard, 29th December
item.description:
The materials stored seem unregulated and in bulk. Many fire extinguishers exposed in the garden. Vast amount of substances in tubs. This house is rented and at least one young child lives there. Not sure if materials are flammable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 447, Hurst Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 29th December
item.description:
Potholes causing issues as you would expect to cars but to make matters worse when I crossed the road I have ended up twisting my ankle!!!!! We pay over £350 a month council tax and it makes me cross the state of Danson Crescent roads and pavements.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lancelot Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside No. 22, 29th December
item.description:
Paving stones are cracked, some are loose which is a major tripping hazard, particularly for elderly people or those with reduced mobility. This is even more dangerous now that is is winter and the pavements can also be slippery. The pavement has been like this for at least 12 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Chesterford Gardens, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chairs, furniture etc, 29th December
item.description:
Just dumped along the fence behind the vans. Needs clearing, along with all the green council bags that were left for 2 weeks, some of which are now busted and have thrown the rubbish back onto the street. Whole area needs care and attention. We pay our council tax too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Durning Road, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracking Pavement, 29th December
item.description:
Cracking Pavement outside 1 Downs Bridge Road with constant surface water.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downsbridge Road, Shortlands, Greater London

item.title: X 2 dumped canniaters in the kerb, 29th December
item.description:
Two dumped gas cannisters in the Kerb on London Lane near the junction with Gilbert Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Lane, Plaistow, Greater London
